block.p: As tax time nears, money is on the minds of most Americans. How much do you know about the bills in circulation today?
Without checking your wallet, test your knowledge of the paper money that is currently issued by the Federal Reserve.
1. These men appear on the $2, $5, $10, $20, $50 and $100 bills. Identify them from the following list and match each with a portrait and denomination:
(A) Jefferson (B) Hamilton (C) Lincoln (D) Jackson (E) Grant (F) Franklin
2. These drawings appear on the backs of the $2, $5, $20, $50 and $100 bills. Match the denomination to the drawing and identify the building or event from this list (choose six) :
(A) Signing of the Declaration of Independence (B) Framing of the Constitution (C) Independence Hall (D) White House (E) United States Treasury Building (F) United States Capitol (G) Lincoln Memorial
3. This new $100 bill was introduced last year with special anti-counterfeiting features. In which ways does the redesigned bill differ from its predecessor?
(C) ''United States of America'' printed on Franklin's coat
4. Below are some chief features on the front and back of a one-dollar bill. Match each with its place on the note.
5. What is the total number of times the word or number one'' appears on a one-dollar bill to denote the value of the currency?
6. The average life of a one-dollar bill is:
(5) A. Signing of the Declaration of Independence, $2.
4. (1) Seal of Federal Reserve Bank issuing the note.
(3) Front of the Great Seal of the United States.
As tax time nears, money is on the minds of most Americans. How much do you know about the bills in circulation today?
Without checking your wallet, test your knowledge of the paper money that is currently issued by the Federal Reserve.
1. These men appear on the $2, $5, $10, $20, $50 and $100 bills. Identify them from the following list and match each with a portrait and denomination:
(A) Jefferson (B) Hamilton (C) Lincoln (D) Jackson (E) Grant (F) Franklin

(A) Signing of the Declaration of Independence (B) Framing of the Constitution (C) Independence Hall (D) White House (E) United States Treasury Building (F) United States Capitol (G) Lincoln Memorial

(C) ''United States of America'' printed on Franklin's coat
4. Below are some chief features on the front and back of a one-dollar bill. Match each with its place on the note.
5. What is the total number of times the word or number one'' appears on a one-dollar bill to denote the value of the currency?
6. The average life of a one-dollar bill is:
(5) A. Signing of the Declaration of Independence, $2.
4. (1) Seal of Federal Reserve Bank issuing the note.
(3) Front of the Great Seal of the United States.
